Posts.Content: No, it's not just you! After taking the steroids for three days I couldn't sleep either. I know it's exhausting but nothing we are going through is easy! Hang on there, we can do this!  Xx
Posts.Title: FEC and sleep

Posts.Content: Hello Becky15 and sr23,  Cobgrats to you sr23 on completion of your treatment!  Becky15, so sorry you have to go through this so young!  I address you both since I was diagnosed when 33 this year in April so we all are quite young to have been diagnosed. I am currently on chemo, 4th cycle this Friday. Hate it but so far so good. I haven't had any nasty infections or have been feeling sick.
Posts.Title: New to here

Posts.Content: Hi all,  Today I am having my second FEC. I am so scared! Again!  Wish me luck!  Xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: My oncologist told me that after my axilla clearance I might feel a funny feeling where the nodes were, I might feel pain in the muscle at the back if some of the nerves were damaged since at that spot there are lots of nerves and blood vessels but then it would gradually pass. And this would happen only IF any nerve was affected and she also said that this rarely happened.
Posts.Title: UNDERARM PAIN

Posts.Content: Hi,  I had just one FEC-T chemo and since Monday this week started hair loss. Today the shedding was very intense. Still have got hair but it is disturbing.  I cut my hair military style as it was quite long and did not want to see it fall off in strands.  Tomorrow is my second chemo. Dreading it! But the more I get through, the less it is left. Trying to be positive!   X
Posts.Title: Hair Loss
